attributes.action: Stop holding up or withholding petitions for leaving the EU without a deal
attributes.additional_details: Just check on social media sites and you will see the evidence you need ... more petitions are being fixed or deleted
attributes.background: It seems as we are being controlled ... petitons on the government website are being fixed ...slowed down or stopped from obtaining full potential

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

There is no policy to hold up petitions for leaving the EU without a deal, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We try to check petitions within seven days, but sometimes this can take longer. At the moment, we are dealing with the exceptionally large number of petitions that were started following the petition to "Revoke Article 50 and remain in the EU", which gathered over 6,000,000 signatures. That large number of petitions means that dealing with petitions is taking slightly longer. 

You might like to sign and share one of these petitions: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/256356  
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235185
